description: Back during ww2 a plane crashed on the mountain and you can now visit the memorial site left over.  It's a 3 minute hike off a logging road if you have a 4x drive or about 30-45 minutes up if you are 2x drive.  You can also busheack a little further up from the crash to find the 2 plane wings which have broken off but they are hard to find.
directions: The forest service road (Mount Bolduc FSR) is accessed off Gordon Mainline about 15 km from Lake Cowichan (where the road turns to dirt just past Gordon Bay Campsite), there's a road heading over to Harris Main (Pacific Marine Highway) and the turn off for the FSR is about 2 km along that road. You head up the FSR (ignoring the sign saying not to) and go up about 5-6 km and the trail will be marked with a ribbon near the very end of the loggind road.  If you are in a 2 wheel drive with low clerance, you can make it up pretty far but will nave to get out and hike for a few kilometers at one point.  There should be a spot on the cliffside just barely big enough to turn your car around and leave it parked on the slope as you ascend the rest of the way on foot.
title: Mt. Buldoc
